intro: Cyanella rosea, commonly known as the pink flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered blooms. Cyanella rosea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
